Pre-Game Insights: England have floated down to St Lucia on a wave of exhalation after avoiding a humiliating first-round exit.
West Indies are fit, focused and firing on all cylinders coming into this contest on an eight-match unbeaten run.
Only the captain, Rovman Powell, has been short of recent runs, but a 24-ball fifty in a warm-up match against Australia is sufficient proof that his eye is still firmly in.
England's middle-order found it impossible to cut loose once the powerplay fielding restrictions had been lifted in their trudge to a deeply one-sided 36-run loss against Australia.
Phil Salt's unrelenting approach at the top of England's order has never been more valuable after his back-to-back centuries in Grenada and Trinidad.
Gudakesh Motie's left-arm offerings have the ability to apply a handbrake to all manner of free-flowing teams, particularly ones quite as stacked with right-handers as England's.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell wants his team to make use of having already played on Wednesday's strip.
Reece Topley predicts strong St Lucian support after England's fans outnumbered the locals in December's T20I series.
